profile_positions.title: Early Career Representative, Electromag. Environment and Interference - Commission E, International
President, Electromagnetic Environment and Interference - Commission E, Portuguese Committee

profile_positions.description: Supporting and guiding ITU delegates in the framework of the NOW4WRC23 ITU Mentoring Programme, promoting inclusiveness and gender equality, equity and parity in the ITU Radiocommunication Sector.
profile_positions.title: Mentor

profile_positions.description: Preparing, organizing, conducting and reporting on WP 3M work on radio propagation experimental data submission, WP 7C work on passive sensor issues and CPM23-2 work dealing with WRC-23 agenda item 1.14, preparing draft texts in conformity with the ITU-R working practices, with full accountability, neutrality and transparency, fostering convergence, supporting inclusiveness and promoting collaborations and partnerships for the collective advance of future generation of ICT.
profile_positions.title: Chairperson

profile_positions.description: Delegate to the ITU-R Study Groups (1/3/4/5/7), submitting and presenting technical contributions and defending the position of ESA in the different groups.
profile_positions.title: Delegate

profile_positions.description: Responsible for managing the ITU-R SG 3 databanks for prediction models testing, reviewing, integrating and consolidating the available databanks, conducting quality assessments of the existing data and of new proposed data for recording, according to the ITU standards, updating records of new experiments, reviewing and updating testing variables and procedures, and testing the existing models, and new proposed models, in agreement with the adopted procedures.
profile_positions.title: Table Keeper

profile_positions.description: Preparing, drafting and editing contributions to the different ITU-R Study Groups and Working Parties.
profile_positions.title: Technical Contributor

profile_positions.description: National head-delegate to the ITU-R SG3 (WPs 3J/K/L/M), leading the submission and delivery of contributions and defending the position of Portugal as member-state, in coordination with the national stakeholders.
profile_positions.title: Head of Delegation

profile_positions.description: Delegate for CEPT ECC groups (including ECC, CPG, WG FM, WG SE), preparing, submitting and presenting technical contributions and defending the position of ESA in the different groups.
profile_positions.title: Delegate

profile_positions.location: European Space Research and Technology Centre, Noordwijk, Netherlands
profile_positions.description:
● Keeps abreast of scientific, technological and regulatory developments for telecommunications and remote sensing, contributing to defining the ESA spectrum policy.
● Defining technical and operational requirements and assessing constraints of future EO programmes (incl. EU Copernicus) w/ respect to radio spectrum use and potential interference, considering the missions objectives and the in-force international, regional and national regulatory frameworks.
● Actively participating on the WRC preparatory activities and the work of technical committees in the framework of the ITU-R, CEPT and SFCG, conducting spectrum sharing and compatibility studies and leading the response to public consultations.
● Closely cooperating with the ESA Frequency Management Office on frequency filing of EO missions to the ITU and supporting operational missions on solving harmful interference cases.
● Identifying technology needs of future missions with respect to propagation prediction methods for interference and sharing studies, methods for interference monitoring, detection, isolation, classification, localization and mitigation, microwave remote sensing techniques and microwave communication technologies, supporting the development of detailed project implementation plans and the procurement and evaluation of tenders.
● Regularly reviewing projects and missions status, assessing results and risks and proposing changes, leading the implementation and ensuring delivery of the required outputs according to the established work plan and within the specified tolerances, in close collaboration with the identified partners, and reporting to relevant boards and committees.
profile_positions.title: Senior Consultant Engineer, Radio Spectrum Management and Technology for Earth Observation 🌍

profile_positions.description: Advising on international, regional and national radio regulatory framework for the design and operation of space-based solutions for IoT and interfacing with national regulator, obtaining the necessary frequency licenses to enable the operations in the framework of the UNIoT project, supported by ESA BIC Portugal.
profile_positions.title: Advisor, Regulatory and Market Access

profile_positions.description:
● Defining and developing spectrum monitoring and control operational methodologies, considering the future radio communications systems and services (e.g. 5G, IoT, M2M), the evolution of the national and international regulatory frameworks and the technological reality.
● Managing and leading the field execution of technical studies and operational works on spectrum monitoring and enforcement, including inspection actions on all radiocommunication services, the control of the human exposure to electromagnetic fields, spectrum utilization and radio noise assessments and interference cases mitigation and solving.
● Supporting criminal investigations of cyber-crimes in close collaboration with other authorities.
● Strategic consultancy on the space sector, including on the definition of the Portuguese Space Agency (Portugal Space) business plan and statutes.
● Consultancy on the spectrum planning and licensing for space services.
● Member of the Portuguese Space Authority team, drafting the regulations concerning the access to and the exercise of space activities.
● Member of the team responsible for radio science and technology outreach for general public.
profile_positions.title: Expert Engineer and Space Authority Officer, Telecommunications and Spectrum Management 📡

profile_positions.description: R&D on propagation engineering for space communication systems: high-order characterization and modelling of Earth-Space radiowave depolarization for high spectral efficiency radio systems design and definition of testing methodologies for the assessment of Earth-Space depolarization.
profile_positions.title: Invited Engineer, Radio Propagation

profile_positions.description:
● R&D in the full life cycle of ESA state-of-art technology projects on propagation engineering for the design and optimization of the future generation of satellite services operating at Ku, Ka and Q/V-bands and of remote sensing systems, developing new propagation prediction models and techniques used as reference by the aerospace industry and recommended by the ITU.
● R&D on satellite ground systems engineering for satellite monitoring and tracking, assisting the propagation measurement campaigns planning, design and execution and integrating, operating and maintaining the ground stations in campaign at Ka and Q/V bands.
● Writing software for data storage, management, validation, analysis and processing, submitting data for reference data banks (e.g. ITU) and preparing technical reports and documents for international projects.
● Assisting and supporting the supervision of MSc students and projects on Satcom, IoT and IoS.
● Institutional ambassador, responsible for the internal and external institutional promotion and representation.
profile_positions.title: Engineer, Satellite Communications and Radiowave Propagation 🛰️

profile_positions.description:
● End-to-end management (including designing, planning, promoting, leading the development and field implementation, and evaluating and reporting) of innovative STEM outreach projects, aiming the knowledge transfer for students and general society.
● Managing recruitment, procurement and other administrative processes.
● Serve as institutional ambassador, responsible for the internal and external institutional promotion and representation.
profile_positions.title: Manager, STEM Outreach

profile_positions.description:
● Build-up, management and leadership of working teams to achieve effective teamwork.
● Managing and promoting, including detailed planning and design, careful overseeing the proper delivery and effectively providing technical training courses on ICT.
● Teaching microwave engineering and radio systems, including radio wave propagation, antennas, waveguides, transmission lines and RF electronics, JAVA Programming and ICT.
● Tutorial orientation and preparation of teaching materials, preparation and correction of assessment tests and exams and pedagogic supervision and leadership of academic projects.
profile_positions.title: Course Director and University Professor

profile_positions.description: Research on radiowave propagation for space communications: high-order statistical characterization and modelling of fade, interfade and inter-event duration, with correlation to the physical phenomena on Earth-satellite slant-paths.
profile_positions.title: Invited Researcher, Radio Propagation
